text: Södra Råda Old Church () was a timbered church building in Gullspång Municipality in Sweden. The church was dated to the 14th century. It was one of the oldest preserved wooden churches in Sweden. The church was destroyed by a fire on 12 November 2001. == References == ==Other websites== Category:Church of Sweden churches Category:Fires in Sweden Category:Wooden churches Category:14th-century buildings and structures
title: Södra Råda Old Church
